replies.msg:
數學唔係科學
1. 科學用cumulative evidence去驗證 (induction) 數學用logical deduction
2. 科學會做實驗 數學唔會
3. 科學永遠都係錯 但不斷接近真理
數學永遠都啱
4. 科學建基於現實世界
數學係純概念活動 而且係自明

replies.msg:
Tell me when was the last time a CS theory was proven false or needed to be adjust because of it did not agree with experimental data.

That happens a lot in physics and other sciences. That's the way how science make progress but no CS. CS is mostly maths. You provre something is correct in CS because it is consistent with a set of axioms. We never run any experiment to verify axioms.

replies.msg:
The crux is falsifiabiltiy.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Falsifiability

A scientific theory can be proven wrong by an experiment. It is a the best approximation of the reality we know until it is disproven. On the contrary CS/maths lacks this.

quote.msg: Are you sure?

Tell me when was the last time a CS theory was proven false or needed to be adjust because of it did not agree with experimental data.

That happens a lot in physics and other sciences. That's the way how science make progress but no CS. CS is mostly maths. You provre something is correct in CS because it is consistent with a set of axioms. We never run any experiment to verify axioms.
Many Algorithms can prove false and need to be adjust because do not agree with experimental data.

replies.msg:
Can you cite an example? I have read many algorithm research papers in the past. Typically there is a proof of correctness. It is like a proof in mathematics. You prove that the algorithm works based on some assumptions or axioms. i.e., you can derive the proof from a finite sequence of logical statements from the axioms. Then there it is usually accompanied by a time or space complexity analysis, which is also maths. If you can can prove that it is O(n * log n) time correctly, then there is no way to disprove it later.

If you propose an algorithm and claims that it 'works' based on limited experimental data, then yeah it works like science but this is not how algorithm research works.

replies.msg: social sciences都可以。你一樣可以form hypothesis然後做實驗話或者同現實對比睇下理論有唔備否定。我覺得係唔係科學重點嘅係理論嘅falsifiability。

其實上面啲人已經講到好好
我再總結下

首先你問呢個問題，就要先明咩係science
science = 一套檢驗事物真確性既辦法：
觀察 - 估 - 做實驗check下總結下規律(induction) - 落結論 （rinse and repeat)

無得做實驗去驗證 真偽既就唔係science
例如神學：只要信，不要問，人地話咩就係咩，check都唔使check，我話啱就啱，而且想check都唔會check到

又例如數學：數學都無得check真偽，因為佢喺由一啲一定啱既axioms推落去，一定係會啱。佢行deduction路線，唔係induction (induction 係歸納總結，係有機會錯，但數學係唔會錯 - 唔包計錯數唔小心個啲）

咁咩係科學呢
一開始就係phychembio呢啲，呢種叫自然科學natural science，用黎研究大自然現象，有非常高既確定性（牛頓一二三定律）

但都有人用咗套科學方法研究人類行為，呢啲就叫social science (Econ, politics, psychology)，但你知啦，人類行為多變，所以啲定律好多都有例外，但大體規律都係有既（例如 絕對既權力使人絕對地腐化 呢啲規律：雖然大部分人都有權用盡，但都有啲國家領袖係會 放棄權力推民主化，好似係汶萊個邊，但呢啲係極少數，不過只要有極少數就可以打破規律，所以你會話呢啲規律無咁準，無咁"science")

至於computer science 似邊個？
似 math多啲
嚴格黎講應該唔係science
但一般民眾唔係咁識所以會放咗落 「理工科」既類別所以當咗係science

quote.msg:
Tell me when was the last time a CS theory was proven false or needed to be adjust because of it did not agree with experimental data.

That happens a lot in physics and other sciences. That's the way how science make progress but no CS. CS is mostly maths. You provre something is correct in CS because it is consistent with a set of axioms. We never run any experiment to verify axioms.
Many Algorithms can prove false and need to be adjust because do not agree with experimental data.

Can you cite an example? I have read many algorithm research papers in the past. Typically there is a proof of correctness. It is like a proof in mathematics. You prove that the algorithm works based on some assumptions or axioms. i.e., you can derive the proof from a finite sequence of logical statements from the axioms. Then there it is usually accompanied by a time or space complexity analysis, which is also maths. If you can can prove that it is O(n * log n) time correctly, then there is no way to disprove it later.

If you propose an algorithm and claims that it 'works' based on limited experimental data, then yeah it works like science but this is not how algorithm research works.

咁咩係科學呢
一開始就係phychembio呢啲，呢種叫自然科學natural science，用黎研究大自然現象，有非常高既確定性（牛頓一二三定律）

但都有人用咗套科學方法研究人類行為，呢啲就叫social science (Econ, politics, psychology)，但你知啦，人類行為多變，所以啲定律好多都有例外，但大體規律都係有既（例如 絕對既權力使人絕對地腐化 呢啲規律：雖然大部分人都有權用盡，但都有啲國家領袖係會 放棄權力推民主化，好似係汶萊個邊，但呢啲係極少數，不過只要有極少數就可以打破規律，所以你會話呢啲規律無咁準，無咁"science")

至於computer science 似邊個？
似 math多啲
嚴格黎講應該唔係science
但一般民眾唔係咁識所以會放咗落 「理工科」既類別所以當咗係science

數學點做唔會錯但數學都有真假共存既現像

用數學去證明都算科學掛
之後都可以用實驗去雙重驗證

replies.msg:
咩叫真假共存 有咩例子解釋下
唔好講到咁玄學

quote.msg:
其實上面啲人已經講到好好
我再總結下

首先你問呢個問題，就要先明咩係science
science = 一套檢驗事物真確性既辦法：
觀察 - 估 - 做實驗check下總結下規律(induction) - 落結論 （rinse and repeat)

無得做實驗去驗證 真偽既就唔係science
例如神學：只要信，不要問，人地話咩就係咩，check都唔使check，我話啱就啱，而且想check都唔會check到

又例如數學：數學都無得check真偽，因為佢喺由一啲一定啱既axioms推落去，一定係會啱。佢行deduction路線，唔係induction (induction 係歸納總結，係有機會錯，但數學係唔會錯 - 唔包計錯數唔小心個啲）

咁咩係科學呢
一開始就係phychembio呢啲，呢種叫自然科學natural science，用黎研究大自然現象，有非常高既確定性（牛頓一二三定律）

但都有人用咗套科學方法研究人類行為，呢啲就叫social science (Econ, politics, psychology)，但你知啦，人類行為多變，所以啲定律好多都有例外，但大體規律都係有既（例如 絕對既權力使人絕對地腐化 呢啲規律：雖然大部分人都有權用盡，但都有啲國家領袖係會 放棄權力推民主化，好似係汶萊個邊，但呢啲係極少數，不過只要有極少數就可以打破規律，所以你會話呢啲規律無咁準，無咁"science")

至於computer science 似邊個？
似 math多啲
嚴格黎講應該唔係science
但一般民眾唔係咁識所以會放咗落 「理工科」既類別所以當咗係science

replies.msg: 即係Formal Science

quote.msg:
係
唔係

視乎你點定義科學

如果話science = nature science
咁computer science就肯定不是科學

如果話science = nature + psychological and social science
咁computer science也肯定不是科學

如果maths, stat, data science係科學，兼且電機工程、電子工程都係科學
咁computer science就係科學

Computer science is not science because we CS people do not follow the scientific process:

1. ask a question
2. form a hypothesis
3. design an experiment to test the hypothesis
4. do the experiment to gather data.
5. draw a conclusion from empirical data.

replies.msg: 您講嘅係所謂 “scientific method” ，但 “science” 嘅範圍係遠超於 scientific method ，並非 scientific method 以外就唔算科學。再講， science 呢個名詞嘅應用上，並不限於 natural science 嗰種形式嘅知識，好多時有更廣濶嘅意義，本屬 engineering 或者係應用層面，都會叫做 science ，例如 medical science、computer science、或者英語口語上代表複雜技術嘅 rocket science 。

quote.msg: Many Algorithms can prove false and need to be adjust because do not agree with experimental data.

Can you cite an example? I have read many algorithm research papers in the past. Typically there is a proof of correctness. It is like a proof in mathematics. You prove that the algorithm works based on some assumptions or axioms. i.e., you can derive the proof from a finite sequence of logical statements from the axioms. Then there it is usually accompanied by a time or space complexity analysis, which is also maths. If you can can prove that it is O(n * log n) time correctly, then there is no way to disprove it later.

If you propose an algorithm and claims that it 'works' based on limited experimental data, then yeah it works like science but this is not how algorithm research works.

係
如果數學唔算science咁CS唔算science
因為呢D唔係empirical
更加多係自己define一個體系出黎用邏輯去推進D theory
